body:
## What's Changed
* Handle SCTE-35 Enhanced EXT-X-ASSET tags by @bbayles in https://github.com/globocom/m3u8/pull/293
* Add missing comma in __all__ by @ihabunek in https://github.com/globocom/m3u8/pull/294

## New Contributors
* @ihabunek made their first contribution in https://github.com/globocom/m3u8/pull/294

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/globocom/m3u8/compare/3.2.0...3.3.0

[Add support for EXT-OATCLS-SCTE35](https://github.com/globocom/m3u8/commit/69aee287d644743b8f1348b50f639129467ec52b)
[Fix issue 291: os.makedirs](https://github.com/globocom/m3u8/commit/a189d8b6338bf4163dfdad096cf81b05a4a183e8)

* [Remove quotes from video range](https://github.com/globocom/m3u8/commit/4eb9e50492f4e23076902494e8def6d6cb52cbf9)
* [Add support for EXT-X-CUE-OUT-CONT attributes in Segment.dumps](https://github.com/globocom/m3u8/commit/d2b9d46cb30e70827fe199f09897b46befea4e55)

* Follow RFC 8261 section 4.3.4.2 for CLOSED-CAPTIONS
* Add support for stable variant/rendition IDs
* Use millisecond accuracy for EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE_TIME
* Dropy support for Python 3.5

BREAKING CHANGES!

* `segment_map` is no longer just a map. It is now a list with all `EXT-X_MAP`. Previous version of this tag was not useful because every segment has its own initialization section
* Remove quotes from `BYTERANGE` attribute

BREAKING CHANGES!

This is version 1.0.0 of m3u8 and it includes a breaking change if you were using custom parser functions.

* Extend custom_tags_parser functionality
* Remove coveralls

* Add ext-x-bitrate hls tag
* Fix hardcoded /tmp directory in test
* Add support for Content Steering tag
* Clear scte35 state on cue-in

- Add Github actions to test the code
- Treat S3 as a URL instead of a local file

- Added additional parsing for simple CUE-OUT with Duration key 
- Added _cueout_duration to _parse_cueout
- Added AVERAGE-BANDWIDTH to IFramePlaylist
- Added VIDEO-RANGE to IFramePlaylist
- Added new playlist delta attributes from v10
- Added HDCP-LEVEL to StreamInfo and IFramePlaylist

- Fixed base path when query string has slashes
- Fixed load file decode issue in non-english platform

* EXTINF tag must not violate floating point spec
* Drop Python 2 support
* Allow users to use proxies
* Allow users to use a custom HTTP client
* Rounded framerate to 3 decimal places per spec
* Support VIDEO-RANGE in StreamInfo

* Order DATERANGE x-<client-attr>s predictably
* EXT-X-GAP support
* Added ability for extra parameters to be passed to Key class
* Add DATERANGE tag support
* Add support for EXT-X-PRELOAD-HINT
* Fixes a problem when a playlist comes with negative numbers, keeping them as they are.
* Allow individual EXT-X-MAP tag for segment

* Add SCTE35 CUE-OUT and CUE-IN support
* Add #EXT-X-SESSION-KEY support
* Missing SSL package import to create an unverified context

* Parse EXT-X-VERSION as an int as per spec
* Option to disable SSL verification
* Ensure correct dumping of rendition report when LAST-PART is 0

* Refactor StreamInfo (uses a class now)
* Introduce session_data tag support
* Ensure that final line is terminated as per spec

* Add support for (preliminary) low latency protocol extensions
* Fix quote handling on ASSOC-LANGUAGE and INSTREAM-ID
* Don't assume EXTINF titles are quoted

* Add FRAME-RATE tag on `dumps`
* Stop using outdated Python versions (3.3, 3.4)
* `dumps` has now a consistent behavior with `loads` including EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME (#141 and #115)

* Fix bug on loading raw content without URI
* Include README to packaging distribution
* Fix README.rst syntax (error to publish package on PyPI)

* Drop Python 2.6 support
* Include X-EXT-MAP on dumps (https://github.com/globocom/m3u8/issues/109)
* Add basic support for parsing custom tags (https://github.com/globocom/m3u8/issues/124)
* add support for uri when loading m3u8 from a string

* support hls attributes video, audio, subtitles and cc
* support hls tag `#EXT-X-DISCONTINUITY-SEQUENCE`
* add support to tag `EXT-X-START`

* some bug fixes
* adds support to commas on title
* adds support `CLOSED-CAPTIONS`
* adds [`EXT-X-MAP` tag](https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-pantos-http-live-streaming-21#section-4.3.2.5)
- enables user to send request http header

- **WARN** Changed API: instead of using `m3u8_obj.key` use `m3u8_obj.keys`
- adds multiple keys
- supports SCTE35 cue markers for envivio and elemental

Thanks @birme @bertothunder @acurro

- supports SCTE35 metadata
- supports timeout on `load`

- adds support for double quotes
- fixes multi media

Thanks @Prendo93  @somsak

name: bug fixes
body:
- Add support for double quote in resolution attributes
- Fix how segment represent itself (**str**)
- Bump version up

name: more tags
body:
- add support for multiple bitrates #4 
- translate relative path to absolute #5 
- support for #EXT-X-CUE-OUT-CONT tags as attributes of Segment 
- support for #EXT-X-INDEPENDENT-SEGMENTS
- add strict mode
- added AVERAGE-BANDWIDTH
- lots of bug-fixes and minor improvements 

THANKS A LOT @Neon-Dlea , @mvmocanu , @GrumpyOldTroll , @cristina0botez  and many others :clap:

name: New meta tags
body:
-  Updated to be #EXT-X-CUE-OUT-CONT instead of #EXT-X-CUE-OUT
-  Updated model, protocol and parser to add cue_out info to Segment object
-  Fix for https://github.com/globocom/m3u8/issues/43, Media (EXT-X-MEDIA) base uri handling.
-  Fix for https://github.com/globocom/m3u8/issues/45, KEYFORMAT addition to EXT-X-KEY
Adds MANIFEST.in

- Add support to multiple keys
- Add a segment attribute to indicate if it has a discontinuity
- Adds program date time for each segment
- Program id and bandwidth are integers

name: Add PROGRAM-DATE-TIME attribute
body: You can see the official doc here http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-pantos-http-live-streaming-07#section-3.3.5

name: Support for python 3
body: Adds support for python3
